titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. J. Foery, Indictment
CWG5212

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Hardin Circuit County
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against } Indict
J. Foery

The Grand Jury of Hardin County in the name & by the Authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse J. Foery of the Offence of permitting games with cards to be played in a house which he at the time was Occupying and had the control of, and at which games Money & property were bet won and lost committed as follows Viz The said J Foery on the day of August & year 1865 and on divers days since in the County Afsd. and permits Joseph Joseberger John Rahn Andre Rahn John Barnes Andrew Depp Jacob Goranflo Adam Beeler Jesse M Carnahan Thomas C Miller Thomas A Murphy & himself and others were names to the Grand Jury aforesaid are unknown to to play divers games with cards and in a house which he at the time was occupying and had the control of and ^at^ all which games money and also property viz treats whiskey, beer cigars tobacco & oysters were bet won and lost against the peace & dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky Information by Jas Farmer J B Shepherd L B Miller James Farmer Thomas C Miller Campbell Hodgen Jesse M Carnahan Thomas A Murphy Jacob Ewing & Alfred Kennedy

Endorsed A true Bill
John Irvin foreman
of the Grand Jury
A Copy Truly Saml Haycraft Clk
Commonwealth
vs } Copy Indictment
J Foery
